G00.desc: The G0 and G1 commands add a linear move to the queue to be performed after all previous moves are completed. These commands yield control back to the command parser as soon as the move is queued, but they may delay the command parser while awaiting a slot in the queue.

E.shortDesc: An absolute or relative coordinate on the E (extruder) axis (in current units). The E axis describes the position of the filament in terms of input to the extruder feeder.

F.shortDesc: The maximum movement rate of the move between the start and end point. The feedrate set here applies to subsequent moves that omit this parameter.

S.shortDesc: Set the laser power for the move.

X.shortDesc: An absolute or relative coordinate on the X axis (in current units).

Y.shortDesc: An absolute or relative coordinate on the Y axis (in current units).

Z.shortDesc: An absolute or relative coordinate on the Z axis (in current units).

G01.desc: The G0 and G1 commands add a linear move to the queue to be performed after all previous moves are completed. These commands yield control back to the command parser as soon as the move is queued, but they may delay the command parser while awaiting a slot in the queue.

E.shortDesc: An absolute or relative coordinate on the E (extruder) axis (in current units). The E axis describes the position of the filament in terms of input to the extruder feeder.

F.shortDesc: The maximum movement rate of the move between the start and end point. The feedrate set here applies to subsequent moves that omit this parameter.

S.shortDesc: Set the laser power for the move.

X.shortDesc: An absolute or relative coordinate on the X axis (in current units).

Y.shortDesc: An absolute or relative coordinate on the Y axis (in current units).

Z.shortDesc: An absolute or relative coordinate on the Z axis (in current units).

G02.desc: G2 adds a clockwise arc move to the planner; G3 adds a counter-clockwise arc. An arc move starts at the current position and ends at the given XYZ, pivoting around a center-point offset given by I and J or R.

E.shortDesc: The amount to extrude between the start point and end point

F.shortDesc: The maximum rate of the move between the start and end point

I.shortDesc: An offset from the current X position to use as the arc center

J.shortDesc: An offset from the current Y position to use as the arc center

R.shortDesc: A radius from the current XY position to use as the arc center

S.shortDesc: Set the Laser power for the move.

X.shortDesc: A coordinate on the X axis

Y.shortDesc: A coordinate on the Y axis

Z.shortDesc: A coordinate on the Z axis

G03.desc: G2 adds a clockwise arc move to the planner; G3 adds a counter-clockwise arc. An arc move starts at the current position and ends at the given XYZ, pivoting around a center-point offset given by I and J or R.

E.shortDesc: The amount to extrude between the start point and end point

F.shortDesc: The maximum rate of the move between the start and end point

I.shortDesc: An offset from the current X position to use as the arc center

J.shortDesc: An offset from the current Y position to use as the arc center

R.shortDesc: A radius from the current XY position to use as the arc center

S.shortDesc: Set the Laser power for the move.

X.shortDesc: A coordinate on the X axis

Y.shortDesc: A coordinate on the Y axis

Z.shortDesc: A coordinate on the Z axis

G4.desc: Dwell pauses the command queue and waits for a period of time.

G5.desc: G5 creates a cubic B-spline in the XY plane with the X and Y axes only. P and Q parameters are required. I and J are required for the first G5 command in a series. For subsequent G5 commands, either both I and J must be specified, or neither. If I and J are unspecified, the starting direction of the cubic will automatically match the ending direction of the previous cubic (as if I and J are the negation of the previous P and Q).

E.shortDesc: The length of filament to feed into the extruder between the start and end point

F.shortDesc: The maximum feedrate of the move between the start and end point (in current units per second). This value applies to all subsequent moves.

I.shortDesc: Offset from the X start point to first control point

J.shortDesc: Offset from the Y start point to first control point

P.shortDesc: Offset from the X end point to second control point

Q.shortDesc: Offset from the Y end point to the second control point

S.shortDesc: Set the Laser power for the move.

X.shortDesc: A destination coordinate on the X axis

Y.shortDesc: A destination coordinate on the Y axis

G6.desc: Direct Stepping allows a host device to issue direct stepper movements in binary format, pre-written by the host device to a page in the device RAM.

E.shortDesc: 1 for positive, 0 for negative. Last value is cached for future invocations. Not used for directional formats.

R.shortDesc: Step rate per second. Last value is cached for future invocations.

S.shortDesc: Number of steps to take. Defaults to max steps.

X.shortDesc: 1 for positive, 0 for negative. Last value is cached for future invocations. Not used for directional formats.

Y.shortDesc: 1 for positive, 0 for negative. Last value is cached for future invocations. Not used for directional formats.

Z.shortDesc: 1 for positive, 0 for negative. Last value is cached for future invocations. Not used for directional formats.

G10.desc: Retract the filament according to settings of M207.

S.shortDesc: Use G10 S1 to do a swap retraction, before changing extruders. The subsequent G11 (after tool change) will do a swap recover. (Requires EXTRUDERS > 1)

G11.desc: Unretract (i.e., recover, prime) the filament according to settings of M208.

G12.desc: Start the nozzle cleaning process. Three types of cleaning patterns are supported: straight strokes, zigzags and circles. This feature requires a dedicated cleaning area on or outside the bed, but within reach of the nozzle. The pattern may be repeated as many times as desired.

S.shortDesc: Number of repetitions of the pattern

T.shortDesc: Number of triangles in the zigzag pattern

X.shortDesc: Include X motion when cleaning with limited axes. (Leave out X, Y, and Z for non-limited cleaning.)

Y.shortDesc: Include Y motion when cleaning with limited axes. (Leave out X, Y, and Z for non-limited cleaning.)

Z.shortDesc: Include Z motion when cleaning with limited axes. (Leave out X, Y, and Z for non-limited cleaning.)

G17.desc: Select workspace plane XY, ZX, or YZ. Allows G2/G3 and G5 to operate in the selected plane when CNC_WORKSPACE_PLANES is enabled.

G18.desc: Select workspace plane XY, ZX, or YZ. Allows G2/G3 and G5 to operate in the selected plane when CNC_WORKSPACE_PLANES is enabled.

G19.desc: Select workspace plane XY, ZX, or YZ. Allows G2/G3 and G5 to operate in the selected plane when CNC_WORKSPACE_PLANES is enabled.

G20.desc: Set units to inches. In this mode, all positions, offsets, rates, accelerations, etc., specified in G-code parameters are interpreted as inches.

G21.desc: Set units to millimeters. In this mode, all positions, offsets, rates, accelerations, etc., specified in G-code parameters are interpreted as millimeters.

G26.desc: G26 Mesh Validation Pattern is designed to be used in conjunction with mesh-based leveling to test the accuracy of the probed mesh.

B.shortDesc: Bed temperature (otherwise 60°C) to use for the test print.

C.shortDesc: Continue with the closest point (otherwise, don’t)

H.shortDesc: Hot end temperature (otherwise 205°C) to use for the test print.

I.shortDesc: Material preset to use for the test print. Overrides S.

L.shortDesc: Layer height to use for the test

O.shortDesc: Ooze amount (otherwise 0.3mm). Emitted at the start of the test.

Q.shortDesc: Retraction multiplier. G26 retract and recover are 1.0mm and 1.2mm respectively. Both retract and recover are multiplied by this value.

G27.desc: Park the nozzle at a predefined XYZ position.

G28.desc: When you first start up your machine it has no idea where the toolhead is positioned, so Marlin needs to use a procedure called “homing” to establish a known position. To do this it moves each axis towards one end of its track until it triggers a switch, commonly called an “endstop.” Marlin knows where the endstops are, so once all the endstops have been triggered the position is known.

L.shortDesc: Flag to restore bed leveling state after homing. (default true)

O.shortDesc: Flag to skip homing if the position is already trusted

R.shortDesc: The distance to raise the nozzle before homing

X.shortDesc: Flag to home the X axis

Y.shortDesc: Flag to home the Y axis

Z.shortDesc: Flag to home the Z axis

G29.desc: The Unified Bed Leveling System (UBL) provides a comprehensive set of resources to produce the best bed leveling results possible. See the full Unified Bed Leveling documentation for more details.

A.shortDesc: Activate Unified Bed Leveling (i.e., M420 S1)

D.shortDesc: Disable Unified Bed Leveling (i.e., M420 S0).

E.shortDesc: Stow probe after probing Each point (P1 only).

F.shortDesc: Fade height. (UBL only! For others use M420 Z)

I.shortDesc: Invalidate a number of mesh points (default 1).

K.shortDesc: Kompare: Subtract (diff) the stored mesh with this index from the current mesh. This destructively operates on the active mesh, and the result should not be used for printing. (Requires UBL_DEVEL_DEBUGGING)

L.shortDesc: Load a mesh. If no index is given, load the previously-activated mesh. The given mesh index will be used for subsequent Load and Store operations.

P.shortDesc: Phase: The Phase commands are used for the bulk of the work to setup a Mesh. In general, you’ll start by initializing with a G29 P0 or a G29 P1 then do further refinement with additional Phases.

Q.shortDesc: Test Pattern. Load the specified Test Pattern to check for correct operation. This command is intended for developers and is not required for everyday bed leveling.

S.shortDesc: Save the mesh to EEPROM in the given slot.

T.shortDesc: Topology: Include a Topology Map in the output.

U.shortDesc: Unlevel: Probe the outer perimeter to assist bed tramming. (Use with G29 P1 O)

W.shortDesc: What?: Display valuable UBL data. (Requires UBL_DEVEL_DEBUGGING)

X.shortDesc: X position for all phases and commands (Default: current X)

Y.shortDesc: Y position for all phases and commands (Default: current Y)

G30.desc: Do a single Z probe at a specified position. By default probe in the current position.

C.shortDesc: Probe with temperature compensation enabled (PTC_PROBE, PTC_BED, PTC_HOTEND)

E.shortDesc: Engage the probe for each point

G33.desc: With the G33 command you can:

C.shortDesc: If omitted iterations stop at best achievable precision. If set iterations will stop at the set precision.

E.shortDesc: Engage the probe for each point.

F.shortDesc: Run (“force”) this number of iterations and take the best result.

O.shortDesc: Probe at probe-offset-relative positions instead of the required kinematic points.

P.shortDesc: Number of probe points. If not specified, uses DELTA_CALIBRATION_DEFAULT_POINTS

R.shortDesc: Temporarily reduce the size of the probe grid by the specified amount.

G34.desc: This command is used to align the ends of the X gantry. See the video demonstration above.

S.shortDesc: Current value to use for the raise move. (Default: GANTRY_CALIBRATION_CURRENT)

Z.shortDesc: Extra distance past Z_MAX_POS to move the Z axis. (Default: GANTRY_CALIBRATION_EXTRA_HEIGHT)

G35.desc: This command runs an interactive procedure to help you adjust the bed corners so that the bed is as true to the machine frame as possible. This is an important step in calibrating your printer and getting the best first layer results.

G38.2-G38.5.desc: The Probe Target commands are used to probe towards (or away from) a workpiece to determine its precise position. You might, for example, use a grounded metal workpiece, with a metal probe spliced into the bed probe circuit.

G42.desc: The G42 command moves the nozzle to the location corresponding to a specific coordinate in the bed leveling mesh. It operates similarly to the G0 and G1 commands except that the provided coordinates are a mesh row and column instead of an absolute or relative position on the bed.

F.shortDesc: The maximum movement rate of the move between the start and end point. The feedrate set here applies to subsequent moves that omit this parameter.

I.shortDesc: The column of the mesh coordinate

J.shortDesc: The row of the mesh coordinate

G53.desc: G53 applies native workspace to the current move. See G54-G59.3 for workspace coordinate system. In CNC G-code G53 is a modifier. It precedes a movement command (or other modifiers) on the same line. Marlin also accepts G53 on a line by itself as the command to return to the native workspace.

G54-G59.3.desc: A workspace is an XYZ offset to the native machine space. All workspaces default to 0,0,0 at start, or with EEPROM support they may be restored from a previous session. See G53 for native space.

G60.desc: Save the current position of all axes in an SRAM buffer for later recall with G61.

S.shortDesc: Memory slot. If omitted, the first slot (0) is used.

G61.desc: Use this command to move to a saved position. To limit the move to only some axes, include one or more axis letters. Otherwise all axes will be included.

E.shortDesc: Flag to restore the E axis

X.shortDesc: Flag to restore the X axis

Y.shortDesc: Flag to restore the Y axis

Z.shortDesc: Flag to restore the Z axis

G76.desc: Calibrate temperature compensation offsets for bed and/or probe temperatures. Temperature compensation values are added to probe measurements when running G29 mesh bed leveling. Currently, calibration only heats up the bed, not the hotend. The probe is heated up by bringing it close to the heated bed and cooled down by moving it away.

G80.desc: Cancels the current motion mode (G0 G1 G2 G3 G5 G38.X). With GCODE_MOTION_MODES enabled, Marlin will remember the last used motion mode which can then be canceled with G80.

G90.desc: In absolute mode all coordinates given in G-code are interpreted as positions in the logical coordinate space. This includes the extruder position unless overridden by M83.

G91.desc: Set relative position mode. In this mode all coordinates are interpreted as relative to the last position. This includes the extruder position unless overridden by M82.

G92.desc: Set the current position to the values specified. In Marlin 1.1.0 and up, the software endstops are adjusted to preserve the physical movement limits. Thus you could use G92 to set the middle of the bed to 0,0 and then run .gcode that was sliced for a Deltabot.

G425.desc: This command performs an automatic calibration of backlash, positional errors, and nozzle offset by touching the nozzle to the sides of a bed-mounted, electrically-conductive object (e.g., a cube, washer or bolt).

T.shortDesc: Perform calibration of one toolhead only.

U.shortDesc: Uncertainty: how far to start probe away from the cube (mm)

V.shortDesc: Probe cube and print position, error, backlash and hotend offset. (Requires CALIBRATION_REPORTING)

title: G-code Marlin Reference
description: function toUpperCase() { [native code] }-code reference for Marlin firmware 3d Printers",
